meanings.definition: To cause (a road or railway) to slope upward on a curve.
meanings.sent1: The engineer superelevates the road to make it safer for drivers going around the bend.
meanings.sent2: The construction crew superelevates the railway tracks to prevent derailments on sharp turns.
meanings.sent3: Why did the road decide to superelevate itself? To give cars a smoother ride!
meanings.sent4: Her determination superelevates her above the challenges she faces in life.
meanings.sent5: The idea of superelevating the road seemed like a genius solution to the traffic problem.

meanings.definition: To raise or elevate to a higher level.
meanings.sent1: The teacher superelevates the students' understanding with engaging lessons.
meanings.sent2: She superelevates her baking skills by practicing new recipes every week.
meanings.sent3: The cat superelevates its hunting game by climbing to higher vantage points.
meanings.sent4: His kindness superelevates the mood of everyone around him.
meanings.sent5: The promotion superelevated her position within the company, bringing new responsibilities.
